(1979) | Misc = }} "'''Tragedy'''" is a song recorded by the [[Bee Gees]], included on their 1979 album ''[[Spirits Having Flown]]''. The single reached number one in the [[UK singles chart|UK]] in February 1979 and repeated the feat the following month on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100]]. Though not originally in ''[[Saturday Night Fever]]'', it has subsequently been added to the musical score of the [[West End theatre|West End]] version of the movie-[[Musical theatre|musical]]. The song knocked "[[I Will Survive]]" by [[Gloria Gaynor]] off the top spot in the U.S. for two weeks before that song again returned to number one for an additional week. In 1979, [[NBC]] aired ''[[The Bee Gees Special]]'' which showed how the sound effect for the explosion was created. Barry cupped his hands over a microphone and made an exploding sound. Several of these sounds were then mixed together creating one large boom heard on the record. It debuted at number two on the [[UK Singles Chart]] before climbing to the top spot in its eighth week on, achieving platinum status. A dance step of putting both hands parallel to the sides of the head became the trademark move of the British group.{{Citation needed|date=April 2009}} "Tragedy" has sold more copies than all three previous [[Steps (group)|Steps]] singles combined.{{Citation needed|date=April 2009}} It spent eighteen weeks in the Top 20 and thirty weeks on the chart in total.{{Citation needed|date=April 2009}} ===Charts=== {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1998) !Peak
